meanings.definition: To waste time or act in a foolish or silly way.
meanings.sent1: The children footled around in the park instead of doing their homework.
meanings.sent2: She footled away the afternoon watching funny cat videos.
meanings.sent3: Despite having a deadline, he chose to footle by rearranging his pencil collection.
meanings.sent4: Her mind footled like a squirrel, jumping from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The lazy cat footled lazily in the sun, ignoring the world around it.

meanings.definition: To talk or act in a trivial, aimless, or foolish manner.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, he footled on about his weekend plans instead of focusing.
meanings.sent2: She footled with her phone, scrolling through social media without purpose.
meanings.sent3: The comedian footled with the audience, telling jokes that made no sense.
meanings.sent4: Her words footled around the topic, never getting to the point.
meanings.sent5: The politician footled through the speech, losing the attention of the listeners.
